intro: Hibbertia complanata subsp. ampliata, commonly known as the broad-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, orange-yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. It is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Hibbertia complanata subsp. ampliata is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
